line_1: I venerate thy hoary hairs,
line_2: Nor e'en thy trembling, starting tears,

line_1: Her heaving breasts and scatter'd hairs;
line_2: Now wild as winds in madness tears

line_1: Welcome, thy silver'd hairs!
line_2: In vain thy youthful airs.

line_1: From green Youth, or hoary Hairs;
line_2: No Return my Nature bears,

line_1: It's Leaves, to deck Aurelia's Hairs.
line_2: But from the slighted Tree he tears

line_1: All but his Wrinkles and his Hairs
line_2: SHUTE is the Darling of his Years,

line_1: All but his Wrinkles and his Hairs
line_2: Young SHUTE his better Likeness bears,

line_1: He beats his breast, he rends his silver hairs —
line_2: The temple nods — an aged form appears —

line_1: Defil'd with Dust his awful silver Hairs,
line_2: But lo! he comes, the Rev'rend Bard appears,

line_1: Defil'd with Dust his awful silver Hairs,
line_2: And his rough Garment, wet with falling Tears.

line_1: Unstrung the nerves, and silver'd o'er the hairs;
line_2: When sinking nature asks our kind repairs,

line_1: To ride before a Grandsire with grey Hairs.
line_2: And say, it ill becomes your tender Years

line_1: That small silk cap; those puritanick hairs,
line_2: Crop'd to the quick, and circling round his ears;

line_1: His brethren's crimes, his father's hoary hairs
line_2: Were all the subject that alarm'd his fears.

line_1: Deceitful counsel lurks in hoary hairs,
line_2: And the last dregs of life are sordid cares.

line_1: Old Truth retains his silver hairs,
line_2: Here Nature no distortion wears,

line_1: And o'er Britannia shakes his fiery hairs;
line_2: High in the front of heaven when Sirius glares,

line_1: Thy snowy neck, and part thy shadowy hairs,
line_2: — There as soft Zephyrs sweep with pausing airs

line_1: And upright stand the bristled hairs;
line_2: The throbbing heart its fears declares,

line_1: And crown our hoary hairs:
line_2: And recompense our cares.

line_1: Thy child shall show respect to thy grey hairs,
line_2: That then, in recompense of all thy cares,

line_1: A brighter Wash; to curl their waving Hairs,
line_2: Assist their Blushes, and inspire their Airs;

line_1: And bids her Beau demand the precious Hairs:
line_2: She said; then raging to Sir Plume repairs,

line_1: Then in a Bodkin grac'd her Mother's Hairs,
line_2: Which long she wore, and now Belinda wears.)

line_1: But want, or sickness, or grey hairs:
line_2: That nothing could excite your cares,
